creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Formed as footed shallow bowl with looping handles on either end which terminate in a heart shape
life_date: London and Pforzheim, Germany, dates unknown
text: As was the custom, the best British silver firms chose not to identify their designers as a matter of policy, so the author of this individual dish remains unknown. The firm of Mürrle-Bennet often adopted the curvilinear whiplash elements fresh from the Continent into their line. In this work, the looping handles terminate in a heart shape with a twisting inside-out effect giving equal emphasis to its silhouette and its cut-out spaces.
title: Loop-handled dish
